page.title: 01HAMMERWOOD EAST TO COWDEN
page.content: A valley running E.W. bisected by Kent-Water which forms the border between Kent and Sussex. From S.E. corner the A264 runs across Holtye Common to Hammerwood, and the B2026 N to minoe crossroads to Cowden and then along the side of Kent-Water. Hammerwood House, built by Letrobe, neglected for years, now being restored by present owner, but restoration being hampered by furious litigation over access. Arable, pastoral fields and settlements were connected with the 16-17th Century Wealden Iron Industry. Today, farming, two service garages, and a builder provide the only work.
